page.title: 19Fishing in the Severn.
page.content: by Ann Hill Since the introduction of holding reservoirs lower down the Severn the life of fish has been affected .Water released from the bottom of dams is colder than the river temperature causing fish to feed less avidly than normal in warmer weather.The introduction of barbel which find the fast stream water much to their liking,into the river the early 60's has caused a fluctuation in the density of fish resident in the river at Stourport.Barbel have pushed the Dace and Chub once caught in their thousands off their traditional spawning grounds.Those that do spawn suffer from loss of eggs by being disturbed or eaten by the barbel. Fishing is a sport enjoyed by people of all ages.
